P008284.project_name: Rehabilitation & Completion of Irrigation & Drainage Infrastructure Project

keywords.cdata: agricultural production, aqueducts, basins, collector drains, construction, cropping patterns, DRAINAGE, DRAINAGE INFRASTRUCTURE, drainage management, drainage system, drainage water, drains, drinking water, engineering, Environmental Management, flood damage, floods, industrial water, IRRIGATION, irrigation canals, irrigation facilities, irrigation infrastructure, irrigation systems, irrigation water, operators, pumping stations, river diversion, secondary canals, sedimentation, silt, streams, water logging, water table

project_abstract.cdata: The additional credit for the Azerbaijan Rehabilitation and Completion of Irrigation and Drainage Infrastructure Project will help finance a cost overrun to complete irrigation and drainage infrastructure works under the original project. The cost overrun mainly occurred due to: (1) an increase during the last few years in the price of construction materials, in particular steel and cement, and fuel; and (2) a greater than anticipated volume of rehabilitation work for one component of the project. The additional financing will be required to fund all the originally planned activities in full, specifically the rehabilitation and enlargement of the Samur-Apsheron Canal (SAC) main supply system from km 27 to 50. It will thus mainly be used to carry out the last civil works contract, but there will also be small allocations to finance consultants. The original project development objectives and expected outcomes will remain unchanged.
